knimeNode.name: R View Scripting
knimeNode.shortDescription: Enables the usage of R views using the local R installation.

fullDescription.intro: Enables the usage of R views using the local R installation. View displays the R View generated by the R command entered within the dialog. All selected columns are written into a CVS file which is then read into R and the entered commands are executed.
fullDescription.option: Path to the local R executable.

Choose a R view from the list of predefined view command and adapt the parameter list. Generic X-Y Plotting, Box Plots, Bar Plots, Cleveland Dot Plots, Association Plots, Conditional Density Plots, Display Contours, Conditioning Plots, Draw Function Plots, Fourfold Plots, Histograms, Plot Columns of Matrices, Mosaic Plots, Scatterplot Matrices, Perspective Plots, Pie Charts, Polygon Drawing, Spine Plots and Spinograms, Star (Spider/Radar) Plots and Segment Diagrams, Sunflower Scatter Plot, 1-D Scatter Plots.
Adapt the R view command's parameter list and enter arbitrary R scripting commands by using all selected columns.

views.view: View displays the png generated by the R command entered within the dialog.

The text sent to standard out during the execution of the external tool. (If it appears in gray, it's the output of a previously failing run which is preserved for your trouble shooting.)
NOTE: Keeping the view open may slow down the process significantly, if it produces a lot of output in a short amount of time.
